title: Unit 4 Checkpoint: Contextual Applications
description: Mini-test focused on modeling and explanation. Covers related rates, motion, linearization, and L'Hôpital's Rule.

remediationStrategy.description: Students scoring below threshold receive focused reteaching before Unit 5 (Analytical Applications).

clusters.reteachFocus: Setup process: draw, label, write equation, differentiate w.r.t. t, THEN substitute
v=s', a=v', speed=|v|, direction and speeding up/slowing down analysis
Verify indeterminate form first, differentiate numerator and denominator separately

assessmentProblems.question: A 10-foot ladder leans against a wall. The base slides away at 2 ft/s. How fast is the top sliding down when the base is 6 feet from the wall?
Water pours into a cone (radius 3, height 6) at 2 ft³/min. How fast is the water level rising when h = 4? (Note: r/h = 3/6 = 1/2, so r = h/2.)
A particle moves along the x-axis with position s(t) = t³ - 9t² + 24t for t ≥ 0. (a) When is the particle moving left? (b) When is it speeding up?
assessmentProblems.answer: v(t) = 3t²-18t+24 = 3(t-2)(t-4). a(t) = 6t-18 = 6(t-3). (a) v<0 on (2,4): moving left. (b) Speeding up when v and a have same sign: v>0,a>0 on (4,∞) ∪ v<0,a<0 on (2,3). So speeding up on (2,3)∪(4,∞).

assessmentProblems.question: Use linearization to approximate √(50). Use f(x) = √x at a = 49.
Is the linearization in the previous problem an overestimate or underestimate? Explain.
assessmentProblems.answer: f''(x) = -1/(4x^(3/2)) < 0 for all x > 0. Since f is concave down, the tangent line lies ABOVE the curve. Therefore the linearization is an overestimate.

assessmentProblems.question: Evaluate: (a) lim(x→0) (eˣ - 1 - x)/x², (b) lim(x→∞) x²·e⁻ˣ.
assessmentProblems.answer: (a) 0/0. L'Hôpital: (eˣ-1)/(2x) → 0/0 again. L'Hôpital again: eˣ/2 → 1/2. (b) Rewrite: x²/eˣ → ∞/∞. L'Hôpital: 2x/eˣ → ∞/∞. Again: 2/eˣ → 0.

assessmentProblems.question: (FRQ) The radius of a spherical balloon is increasing at 0.5 cm/s. (a) Find the rate of change of volume when r = 10 cm. (b) Find the rate of change of surface area when r = 10 cm. (V = 4πr³/3, SA = 4πr²)
SPIRAL: Find the equation of the tangent line to y = ln(x) at x = e. Then use it to approximate ln(3).
